key_title: Key to the species of Astrotricha

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Araliaceae

source.author: Henwood, M.J.; Makinson, R.O.; Maling, K.L.
source.title: Araliaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Henwood, M.J.; Makinson, R.O.; Maling, K.L. (1999). Araliaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Upper surfaces of leaves smooth, lacking granules, asperities, or wrinkles
Upper surfaces of leaves with granules, asperities, and/or wrinkles
Leaves less than 2 mm wide, linear; midvein of lower surface not detectable through thick indumentum
Leaves 6–18 mm wide, narrowly elliptic; midvein of lower surface usually evident through indumentum

Leaves 45–95 mm long, 6–11 mm wide; petals of terminal umbels pink to purplish or white to cream or rarely pale green, petals of lateral umbels white to cream or pink to purplish; fruits 2.5–3.5 mm long
Leaves 106–135 mm long, 11–18 mm wide; petals of terminal and lateral umbels concolorous, all white or all pale yellowish-green; fruits 2–2.5 mm long
Leaves 3–10 mm wide, not linear
Leaves less than 3 mm wide, more or less linear
Upper surfaces of leaves with fine granules only, lacking large acute asperities or protuberances
Upper surfaces of leaves with large acute asperities or protuberances (sometimes also with finer granules)
Leaves narrowly elliptic or narrowly oblanceolate (widest at or above middle); leaf apex obtuse to subacute
Leaves either narrowly ovate (widest near base) or oblong-elliptic (c. straight-sided); leaf apex obtuse

Leaves narrowly oblanceolate (widest above middle), often a few slightly spathulate (widest just below the obtuse apex); upper surface of leaf with openly distributed very erect and narrow-spiculate protuberances, each usually subtended by a short wrinkle, surface glossy between

Leaves narrowly elliptic, narrowly oblong-elliptic, or narrowly ovate, widest at middle or near base, or straight-sided; upper surface of leaf with more or less densely distributed granules and/or robust subtriangular protuberances, surface between dull
Leaves 13–35 (–45) mm long, narrowly ovate or narrowly oblong-elliptic; larger protuberances of leaf surfaces mainly towards the margins
Leaves (20–) 35–70 (–120) mm long, narrowly oblong-elliptic; larger protuberances of leaf surfaces more or less uniformly distributed
Leaf upper surface with many conspicuous coarse short obtuse wrinkles, often each surmounted by a short subtriangular asperity
Leaf upper surface lacking conspicuous wrinkles but with densely to openly distributed fine granules or larger asperities
Leaf upper surface with very small fine granules only, lacking larger c. erect subtriangular to spiculate protuberances
Leaf upper surface with at least some large c. erect subtriangular to spiculate protuberances, often also with smaller granules
Leaf upper surface with the midvein shallowly channelled; inflorescence axes and pedicels densely and closely white-lanate
Leaf upper surface with the midvein deeply channelled; inflorescence axes and pedicels closely to loosely brown- or grey-floccose
Petals of terminal and lateral umbels of inflorescence discolorous (those of the terminal umbels pale yellow-green, those of the lateral umbels white to cream); inflorescence (100–) 200–300 mm long

Petals of terminal and lateral umbels of inflorescence concolorous, either white to cream or pale yellow-green (petals of the terminal umbels sometimes a darker shade of same colour); inflorescence 30–70 (–170) mm long
Fruit with a hollow locellus on either side of the endosperm in each mericarp; leaf upper surface with large subtriangular protuberances only, lacking granules
Fruit lacking locelli; leaf upper surface with fine granules and large subtriangular to spiculate protuberances, or the latter only
Leaves often slightly spathulate at apex; leaf upper surface with well-spaced slender erect-spiculate protuberances
Leaves never spathulate at apex; leaf upper surface with dense to openly distributed, robust subtriangular protuberances, often also finer granules
Leaf upper surface with smaller granules more frequent than larger protuberances; inflorescence 30–70 (–170) mm long; petals white to cream or pale yellowish-green
Leaf upper surface with larger protuberances more frequent than smaller granules; inflorescence 60–260 mm long; petals white to cream, occasionally tinged purplish
